MB85RC1MT I3C FRAM Memory Driver
devices

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides a comprehensive hardware abstraction layer for the Fujitsu MB85RC1MT ferroelectric random access memory (FRAM). The driver enables high-speed, non-volatile memory operations through the I3C interface. FRAM technology offers virtually unlimited write endurance, instant write capability, and low power consumption, making it ideal for data logging, configuration storage, and applications requiring frequent write operations.

Key Features

  1. 128K FRAM Memory: Non-volatile ferroelectric memory with instant write.
  2. Unlimited Write Endurance: No wear-out mechanism like flash memory.
  3. I3C Interface: High-speed digital communication with advanced features.
  4. Fast Write Operations: No write delays or page programming required.
  5. Low Power Consumption: Ultra-low power operation for battery applications.
  6. Blocking and Non-blocking Operations: Flexible data transfer modes.
  7. DMA Support: Efficient large data transfers with timeout mechanisms.
  8. Device ID Support: Built-in device identification and verification.

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure MB85RC1MT FRAM device via I3C interface
  • Perform blocking read and write operations for immediate data access
  • Support non-blocking read and write operations with callback mechanisms
  • Handle device identification and verification
  • Provide flexible addressing for 128K memory space (0x0000 to 0x1FFFF)
  • Support both single-byte and multi-byte data transfers
  • Manage DMA operations with timeout and completion callbacks
  • Handle I3C-specific communication protocols and error conditions

Usage

  1. Initialize I3C host interface and configure I3C module
  2. Initialize MB85RC1MT device with am_devices_i3c_mb85rc1mt_init()
  3. Verify device presence with am_devices_i3c_mb85rc1mt_read_id()
  4. Perform blocking writes with am_devices_i3c_mb85rc1mt_blocking_write()
  5. Perform blocking reads with am_devices_i3c_mb85rc1mt_blocking_read()
  6. Use non-blocking operations for high-performance applications
  7. Monitor completion status through callback functions or polling
  8. Terminate device with am_devices_i3c_mb85rc1mt_term() when finished

Configuration

  • Set up I3C interface parameters and timing
  • Configure FRAM memory addressing (16-bit addresses for 128K space)
  • Set up DMA parameters for efficient large data transfers
  • Configure timeout mechanisms for reliable operation
  • Set up callback functions for non-blocking operations
  • Configure error handling and retry mechanisms
  • Optimize transfer sizes for best performance

Function Documentation

◆ am_devices_i3c_mb85rc1mt_blocking_read()

uint32_t am_devices_i3c_mb85rc1mt_blocking_read ( void * pHandle,
uint16_t ui16SubAddr,
uint32_t * pData,
uint32_t ui32NumBytes )

Read data from mb85rc1mt device based on sub address.

Parameters
pHandle- Pointer to device handle
ui16SubAddr- Address of desired data in device
pData- Buffer to store the received data from device
ui32NumBytes- Number of bytes to read from device

This function reads data from the sub address of device, and returns the result as an 32-bit unsigned integer value.

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_i3c_mb85rc1mt_blocking_write()

uint32_t am_devices_i3c_mb85rc1mt_blocking_write ( void * pHandle,
uint16_t ui16WriteAddr,
uint32_t * pData,
uint32_t ui32NumBytes )

Programs data into mb85rc1mt device based on sub address.

Parameters
pHandle- Pointer to device handle
ui16WriteAddr- Address of desired data in device
pData- Buffer to write the device data from
ui32NumBytes- Number of bytes to write to device

This function writes data to the given sub address of device, and returns the result as an 32-bit unsigned integer value.

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_i3c_mb85rc1mt_init()

uint32_t am_devices_i3c_mb85rc1mt_init ( uint32_t ui32Module,
void * pI3cHandle,
void ** ppDevHandle,
am_devices_i3c_mb85rc1mt_config_t * pDevConfig )

Initialize the mb85rc1mt device.

Parameters
ui32Module- I3C instance
pI3cHandle- I3C controller handle
ppDevHandle- Device handle which needs to be return
pDevConfig- I3C device structure describing the target device
Note
This function should be called before any other am_devices_i3c_mb85rc1mt functions. It is used to tell the other functions how to communicate with the I3C devices.
Returns
Status.

◆ am_devices_i3c_mb85rc1mt_nonblocking_read()

uint32_t am_devices_i3c_mb85rc1mt_nonblocking_read ( void * pHandle,
uint32_t ui32SubAddr,
uint32_t * pData,
uint32_t ui32NumBytes )

Read data from mb85rc1mt device based on sub address.

Parameters
pHandle- Pointer to device handle
ui32SubAddr- Address of desired data in device
pData- Buffer to store the received data from device
ui32NumBytes- Number of bytes to read from device

This function reads data from the sub address of device via DMA mode, and returns the result as an 32-bit unsigned integer value.

Returns
32-bit status

De-Initialize the mb85rc1mt driver.

Parameters
